Question: How to switch between two windows in browser using Selenium java: :I'm working with Selenium Automation. In this, When i click a link in a current window, a new window opens. I just want to switch the control to the new window. But i can't do this.Actually the new window is an auto-generated one. That is, link will be generated dynamically. Help me friends...
Please using this api: Iterator.next.

Question: How to switch between two windows in browser using Selenium java: :I'm working with Selenium Automation. In this, When i click a link in a current window, a new window opens. I just want to switch the control to the new window. But i can't do this.Actually the new window is an auto-generated one. That is, link will be generated dynamically. Help me friends...
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: 
<<<api>>>: 
WebDriver.switchTo().window(String windowHandle)

<<<code>>>: 
Set<String> windowHandles = driver.getWindowHandles();
Iterator<String> iterator = windowHandles.iterator();
String parentWindow = driver.getWindowHandle(); // Save the ID of the parent window
String childWindow = iterator.next(); // Get the ID of the first child window

if (!parentWindow.equals(childWindow)) {
    driver.switchTo().window(childWindow);
} else {
    childWindow = iterator.next();
    driver.switchTo().window(childWindow);
}

<<<explanation>>>: 
This code switches the focus to the next window. It first gets the set of all window handles using `driver.getWindowHandles()`. Then it iterates over this set and gets the IDs of all windows. The parent window is saved in `parentWindow` variable. Then it checks if the parent window ID is not equal to the child window ID. If it's not equal, it switches the focus to the child window. If it is equal, it gets the ID of the next window and switches the focus to it.

Note: This code assumes that there are at least two windows open. If there is only one window, it will throw an exception.

Also, this code does not handle the case when there are more than two windows. If you need to handle that, you would need to add more logic to the iterator.

This code is using the `switchTo().window(String windowHandle)` method of the `WebDriver` interface, which switches the focus to a window with the given window handle.

This code should be placed in the location where you want to switch to the new window.

Please replace `driver` with your actual WebDriver instance.
